chatter_mode: Enter chatter mode and continuously submit the transcript via query_llm and analyze it according to the instructions in the parameters to this command.
command_mode: Enter command mode. In this mode, the first word you speak is interpreted as a command, and the remaining words are arguments.
create_alias: Create an alias. The first argument is the alias, and the remaining arguments should be a command to be issued when the alias is spoken, followed by arguments.
delete_alias: Delete an alias. Give the name of the alias as the argument.
get_help: Display a listing of builtin and script commands. By default shows help for aliases, built-ins and scripts. Say "##get_help## aliases", "##get_help## built-ins", "##get_help## commands", "##get_help## modes", or "##get_help## scripts" to restrict output type, or say "##get_help## <command>" to get verbose help for a specific command.
input_text: Send the arguments to the currectly-focused window element as if they were typed from the keyboard.
interactive_mode: Enter interactive mode. In this mode, all spoken words are treated as if they are preceeded by the 'input' command.
list_items: By default, lists the currently running applications that have windows. Can also list applications in the PATH environment variable ('##list_items## applications') or can list currently defined aliases ('##list_items## aliases').
press_enter: Send an 'enter' keypress to the currently focused window element
query_llm: Sumbit a query to an LLM.
resume_execution: Resume command mode after it has been suspended.
show_application: Bring the specified application to the foreground. This will choose the first application that contains the arguments as a substring of the window title or the executable name of the application.
show_transcript: Print the accumulated transcript to console.
web_search: Perform a Google search using the arguments as the search query.
